main event: A luminous object was observed rapidly descending in the sky for 2-3 seconds on June 17, 1960.
interesting points: The object appeared 50-60 degrees above the horizon and was moving downward at a high speed,The brightness of the object decreased very rapidly during the sighting,The observer does not believe it was a falling star,An astronomy acquaintance confirmed this wasn't a typical meteor sighting,The report was acknowledged by a Major in the USAF for further investigation.
witness description: an individual with an acquaintance in astronomy who studies UFOs
